title: Dear Stashu, if Vlad turns out weak numbers-wise are you open to raising his bases and/or ratios?
body:
This is something I've seen whenever Vlad has come up lately. People are saying his new kit is excellent but a little underwhelming.

Bear in mind I don't have a PBE acc, so my opinion on this is hopefully taken with a grain of salt.

His new kit on the whole looks really good, as I've said before in threads and comments. New levels of counterplay and decision-making are present that would've been impossible with the current Live Vlad.
I understand that the decisions to lower his AP ratios and raise his synergy with health-focused builds have been towards the effect of making him closer to his newfound "Juggermage" identity (which I personally am wholly in favour of), and that's all great.

But if it turns out that he's lacking too much in damage/sustain (his primary tools) then would you be open to buffing his numbers? I know that the patch immediately following large updates is sure to be filled with unreliable data due to people being inexperienced with playing/playing against the updated Champions and items, so I understand if it takes a patch or two to smooth things out as it did with the Juggernaut update.

If you find this Stashu (or any Rioter with the place to say), I hope you'll consider it.

Sincerely,
A Vlad main.

Not Stashu but I can answer this.

The answer is yes, the champion update teamwill be heavily monitoring and tuning the new mages for the first month after release. After that they go over to the live gameplay team. If you look back to the juggernaut or marksmen updates you will see tons of changes that got made in the first month of release. Quinn even got a new reworked blind added. 

In some cases if a champion is significantly struggling or significantly powerful we may even hot fix them immediately as seen with Skarner and Darius right after juggernauts were released.

While the PBE is a great place to get feedback on kit feel and design it is a hard place to judge balance. This is why most of the changes were "feel" changes like the change to the way the E works to clear minion waves Stashu implemented. Our internal play test team feels that he is pretty balanced right now so we are waiting to see how he looks once he hits live.

While the live server will definitely be a more accurate place to judge his power, I feel like he'll have the same issues as old Vlad. If he's weak, he'll get buffed. Then nerfed because he's over-bearing, then never looked at for a buff again because it'll make him over-bearing.

The issue is his reliability. I'm not even talking about his new kit changes. Vlad has ALWAYS has problems making an impact because he needs things to be within 600 range of him, and he can't force anyone to be there. Worse yet, he's primarily AoE, meaning he optimally wants to be in the middle of a fight. 

Essentially, unlike every other champion, his kit has nothing to enable itself. People have to LET him be successful. It doesn't matter how strong or weak this champion is. If the enemy team is decent, Vlad does not function.

Considering his functional unreliability, along with his skills being made less reliable, he should have gotten something in his kit to enable itself, like every other champion in the game. This could have been anything from an actually powerful Q MS buff (whole CD duration) to ult slowing on cast, similar to Eve ult. 

As it stands, Vlad will still be forced into being either overwhelming or too unreliable to use, and that hasn't been touched with this rework. It actually made that issue worse.
